dialogues.text: What time is it? WILLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for you to call her and finally get laid man! (handing him the phone) Come on! DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's twelve thirty. She might be back by now. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Joel gets the phone number out of his pocket. WILLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's this chick look like? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, she's got brown hair. Pretty hot. Kind of working-class looking... WILLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean by that? Willie stares at Joel for a beat. Joel can't tell if he's offended Willie or not. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm... Oh you know,... WILLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she kind of slutty lookin'? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Beat. Joel's not sure if that was the right answer either WILLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright! That's how I like 'em.
JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... (UNCOMFORTABLE LAUGH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda nasty, heh heh... Joel starts dialing the number. JOEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope I don't wake her up... (LISTENS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's busy. DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. At least you know she's home. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. WILLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try her again. Come on. Joel hits redial. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still busy... Man, what kind of person doesn't have call-waiting. WILLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have call-waiting. I hate call-waiting. Every time I hear that goddamn clicking sound, I wanna put my fist through someone's head. Beat. Once again, Joel doesn't know whether to shit or wi his watch. Willie stares at him, then WILLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haaa ha! Man you really do get paranoid when you're stoned... Seriously though, I fuckin' hate call-waiting. JOEL (NERVOUS CHUCKLE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Willie grabs the phone. WILLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here let me dial. You're too stoned.

Willie grabs the piece of paper with Cindy's number. He looks at it, starts to dial, then pauses, realizing something. Willie looks up at Joel, with slowly building rage, then hangs up the phone. WILLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you why you're getting a busy signal. This is my number. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? But... Beat. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... You're joking right? Trying to make me paranoid? Joel waits for Willie to start cracking up. He doesn't. H just continues glaring at Joel. We hear the FRONT DOOR UNLOCK. Everyone looks. CINDY enters. CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Sorry I'm late, I... (NOTICING JOEL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel? What are you doing here...? Willie stands up and walks over to Joel's chair. Dean suddenly stands up. DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it looks like you guys got a lot to talk about here so I think I'm just gonna go ahead and take off. Later guys. Dean bolts. Willie moves in closer on Joel. Joel starts t leave, but Willie blocks him. WILLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda slutty? Willie grabs Joel and throws him against the wall. Joel tries to make a break for the door, but Willie hauls off punches him across the face. The ass-kicking begins as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel limps into the house, his face bruised black and blu from the ass-kicking. He looks awful. As he limps into the bedroom as quietly as possible, he t on something, waking up Suzie. She turns on a light and s Joel. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God Joel, are you alright? What happened? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. I'm fine. I just ah... got my ass kicked. Go back to sleep. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? By who? What happened? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just... some guy over at Scoreboards. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me drive you to the hospital. You need to get checked out. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'll be fine. I just want to sleep right now, okay? SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you're okay? It looks like your nose is broken, and your EYE-- JOEL (AGITATED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it! People get their asses kicked all the time! It's no big deal. Go back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel walks past his Secretary.
SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Joel. Brian wanted to see you-- (NOTICING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, what happened? Joel keeps walking, MUMBLES something about falling down stairs, goes into his office and shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel walks over to the window overlooking the production area. He looks down and sees Cindy working, with her back turned. Shakes his head. Brian KNOCKS on the door and enters, looking worried. BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... Did you talk to Step yet? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He isn't returning my calls. BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... We've got problems. He did hire a lawyer -- Joe Adler -- he's that personal injury lawyer you see on all the bus-stop benches. You oughtta see this guy. He's a real piece of shi-- (noticing Joel's face) Oh man, what happened to you? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I fell down some stairs. BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn... Well anyway, I hate to say this, but I think we're screwed. There's no way this Adler guy is gonna settle for anything less then bankrupting us. Says he'll sue us into the stone age. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clutches his head MISERABLE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... I gotta talk to Step. Brian looks at Joel's bruised face.
BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, everyone's getting hurt. Cindy came in with a black eye today. You hear how she got it? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... no. BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step did it. Can you believe that? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he--! (CATCHES HIMSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Where did you hear that? BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what she told Mary. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... Step? Does he even know her? BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently they've been going out. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, it's weird. They didn't even meet here. They met at a grocery store or something. Just a total coincidence. Joel looks down at Cindy on the production floor, his min reeling. BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, we're gonna have to hire a couple of new people because CINDY'S QUITTING-- JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. And if it's okay with you, I'd like to go ahead and fire Hector. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire Hector? What for?
BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Mary's purse? Sylvia's wallet? It's gotta be him. Who else could it be? Joel looks down at Cindy with growing suspicion. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Don't fire him. Just trust me on this. Give him another week. If anything else is stolen, then you can fire him. BRIAN (PUZZLED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. If you say so. Brian looks Joel over. BRIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, are you okay? Have you seen a doctor? Joel's Secretary BEEPS in.

dialogues.speaker: SECRATARY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Joel, Dean is on line one for you. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, thanks. (TO BRIAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better get this. Brian leaves. JOEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man. Sorry I bailed on you like that last night. It's just that I don't like to get involved in other people's personal shit, you know what I mean? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't even know Willie had a girlfriend. She must be new. Man, Willie looked pissed. (CHUCKLES) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: DEAN, (CON T'D)
dialogues.text: I thought he was gonna take a swing at you there for a second. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did take a swing at me Dean. Several swings. In fact, he beat the living shit out of me. DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, really? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. DEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Man, that really goes to show you -- this town is smaller than you think. You really gotta be careful. Joel hangs up and walks out of his office, past his Secretary. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not feeling well. I'm going to go home early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel turns the corner to his house and does a double-take he sees BRAD'S TRUCK going the opposite direction. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Joel slams on the brakes, turns around, chases Brad's tru down and cuts him off, forcing him to stop. They both get of their vehicles. Joel is livid. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell were you doing on my street again?! BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you weren't supposed to be home for another four hours-- Whoa, what happened to your face? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to improvise a tough, snappy comeback, but can't quite make it WORK) (MORE)
JOEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same thing that's gonna happen.. Your face is gonna look worse if... GOD DAMMIT! If I ever catch you anywhere near my house or my wife again, I'll have you arrested. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? Suzie let me in. Joel is stumped -- Brad actually has a point. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with you anyway? Do you do this with all your clients -- just keep coming back and hanging around? BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. This is my first one. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! I thought you were a professional! BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look man, I know she's your wife an' shit, but you might as well know -- I think we're in love. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In love?! (COMING UNGLUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HA! Man are you stupid. You are so goddamn dumb. You think she loves you? You're nothing but a piece of ass to her. That's all. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so dude. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you don't think so "dude?" Well did you ever think about this: she doesn't even know that I paid you to have sex with her -- did that cross your small mind? BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uuh..
JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about I go home right now and tell her? Tell her you did it for the money. How about that loverboy? Brad suddenly looks worried. This really freaks him out. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't do that. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think so? Watch me. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing he's serious) No... Dude, please don't. Please? Joel starts back to his car. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look man, we really have a special thing going on. Please don't mess it up... Joel stops. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mess it up?! You're talking about my wife! My house! Stupid- ass! Joel gets in his car and starts it. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out to him) Dude, you can't do this to me. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes I can... Joel peels out, drives half a block and turns into his driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel walks in, still pissed off. Suzie is sitting on the couch, a little surprised to see him. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hi. You're home early.
JOEL (COLD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Joel walks over to the sliding glass door, looks outside the pool. It's filthy. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how was that new pool cleaner? Suzie is caught off guard -- wonders if she's busted -- b she plays it cool. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... What do you mean? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think I mean?... Did he do a good job cleaning the pool? SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... well-- JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he get all the... leaves? It doesn't really look that clean. I mean I'm looking at it, and I'd say it's pretty goddamn filthy. Did the guy even clean it at all? It sure doesn't look like it. SUZIE (NERVOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well yeah, I guess he didn't do a very good job. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he did a horrible job. I don't think we should use him anymore. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Suzie watches Joel leave, a slight look of guilt on her f SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right, Joel? You want an aspirin or anything?
JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick shot of Joel staring up at the ceiling shaking his head, can't believe all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a WIDE SHOT we see Joel's car is parked on the street. walks up and rings the doorbell. We see Step answer, talk him and then invite him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step and Joel enter. Step's 300 POUND HALF-BROTHER sits o ratty couch watching TV, drinking a huge plastic bottle o Pepsi. He looks like he's been sitting there for years. T TV is deafeningly loud. STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, I don't think you've ever been to my house before. Have you? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking above the TV) Yeah, I don't think so. I would've remembered... STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my half brother Phil. Joel starts to motion "don't get up," then realizes that' not happening anyway. Phil nods. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... Hey Step, can we talk in another room. STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, let's go out back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel and Step sit at a picnic table.
STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, my lawyer told me not to talk to you. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not here to try to talk me out of suing are you? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no... No, I'm just kind of curious about... ah... So you've been going out with Cindy, huh? STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir. She's my girlfriend. We might even get married after all this lawsuit-settlement stuff gets worked out. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .so some of the guys at work are saying you gave Cindy that black eye. STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? That ain't true at all. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know it's not. STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got it from falling down some stairs. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm... Look, you might wanna be careful with Cindy. STEP (DEFENSIVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not sure how to put this, but... You know, you got a lot of money coming your way with this settlement. You might wanna be CAREFUL-- STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. No, she didn't even know about that 'til after we started going out.
JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about that? STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. I didn't tell her about it for a while 'cuz I was kind of embarrassed, you know? You don't tell a girl you just met that you lost one of your balls. Especially a girl as hot as Cindy. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... (DELICATELY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know she lives with this guy Willie right? STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's her ex. She broke up with him. She's gonna move out. She just needs to get all her stuff outta there. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about that? STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. She's moving in with me. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Hmm... STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know Cindy's got some problems, but she means well. She's the best thing that ever happened to me. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, okay... If you say so. Another thing -- you just might want to watch your back. Some of the guys at work who think you gave Cindy the black eye were talking about paying you a visit -- you know, getting even. STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well I'm not worried about that. (dead-serious, proud) I could kick anyone's ass at that whole company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad and Suzie are by the pool which is filthy. Brad star coming on to Suzie. She pushes him away. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Brad, we can't. I'm sorry, but we have to stop doing this. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not right. I feel horrible. Besides, I think Joel's getting suspicious. And you gotta start cleaning the pool too. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I've never felt this way about anyone before. And I've been with a lot of chicks. SUZIE (TURNED OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh... Look Brad, the truth is I love my husband. I really do. This was all a big mistake. I'm sorry. I don't know what got into me, but we have to stop this. I want to make my marriage work again. I'm going to tell Joel about the whole thing and just hope he forgives me. And even if he doesn't, at least I won't be carrying around this horrible feeling. I just can't stand that he doesn't know. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... This doesn't mean we can't still see each other though, right? SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yes it does. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of all the things I just said. (MORE)     75 SUZIE (CONT'D) (PATIENTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need me to say them again? BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see you tomorrow? SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. BRAD (PLEADING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about next week? SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Look, you gotta go Brad. Joel could be home any second. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you tomorrow. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (just trying to get rid of HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay, just go and we'll talk later. Brad leans to kiss her, she pushed him away and he finall leaves. SUZIE (TO HERSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, what a moron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel sits deep in his chair, bummed out, staring down at manufacturing area. Brian walks in. BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... you ready? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting with Step's lawyer. Or lawyers I should say. It's today remember? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit... Alright. Joel drags himself out of the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE ADLER, is holding court with the various lawyers and paralegals waiting for the meeting to start. As promised, is awful. He looks like Henry Winkler with an extra Y chromosome and a lot of steroids. (Maybe cast Gene Simmon with his hair pulled back in a pony tail.) ADLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .You see, if both his balls had been knocked clean off, he would be a good case, but not a great case: A man with no balls is no man at all. He's a freak. He's barely human. He's gross. And a jury will never feel like they can walk in the shoes of a ball-less, neutered, he/she freak. But Step. He's still got one ball - barely. He's still a man. A man who's very manhood has been jeopardized, but still a man. And that manhood, that very sense of what you are as a human being is hanging by a thread. Jesus, you can't get more dramatic than that. That brave ball, hanging on for dear life, hanging on for justice, is going to be the hero of this trial. I'm tellin' ya this Step guy is the fuckin' Holy Grail, the Powerball Jackpot. And you all laughed at me when I bought those bus bench ads. But I knew the asses of those poor slobs that sit on those benches and ride those sweaty, stinking, cattle cars are our future. And I -- Joel and Brian walk in. ADLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello. I'm Joe Adler... Everybody starts introducing each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of employees including Mary, Garielle, and Rory a talking, getting worked up.
RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .And when they sell the company, Joel and Brian are gonna be the one's who get rich, and-- MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're the ones doing all the work. GABRIELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bullshit man. We should get a piece of it. I work my ass off. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabrielle and I work harder than anybody. I should be making what Brian makes. If you add up all the crates I move, I lift 10,000 pounds a day. Minimum. GABRIELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Here he's gonna make a million dollars, and we're the ones who do everything. I went to college. For three years. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we quit, this place couldn't run. They wouldn't be able to sell this place for anything. JIM, a tall skinny 50-something guy with a ridiculously b mustache and a little paunch, chimes in. JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why what we should do is, is we should all go on strike -- demand stock in the company before it sells. If General Mills knew we were on strike, they wouldn't buy this place until the strike was over. That way they'd have to give us stock. Jim points to his head, gives everyone a "how's that" nod It starts to build steam. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right man. We should do it. We should strike.
MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. I could get a job at Gemco like that. At Gemco, all the employees are owners -- even says so on the name tags. GABRIELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm. I could get a job at Southwest Airlines...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting is already in progress. On Adler's side of th table are two other lawyers and a couple of paralegals. O Joel's side it's just he, Brian and Joel's secretary. May one lawyer who doesn't say much. Everybody has in front of them a small stack of documents The confrence room, like Joel's office, has a full length window facing the manufacturing area. ADLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok gentlemen. We've gone through everything and the only way we would even begin to consider a settlement would be to the tune of the number you see on the bottom of page 18. Does everyone have this? Joel and the rest of them find page 18. Joel is stunned b the number. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!!!? (so pissed he can barely get the words out) We don't have this much money! Not even close! ADLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in cash you don't. Of course not. But if you were to sell off your assets: the property lease, the equipment, the-- JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the ff-- Are you shitting me!? That would bankrupt us! BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what I've been trying to tell you Joel...
JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think I'm just going to give up this entire company that I built from the ground up-- Adler jumps up, dripping with phoney, forced indignation. ADLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about what my client gave up!? His testicles! How about that!? He walks over to the door... ADLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, I'll make a deal with you - - we will drop this case right now if you come over here and put your testicles right here (indicates the space between the door and the HINGES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and let me slam this door like this... Adler SLAMS the door ridiculously hard. ADLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. We can settle this right now -- call it even. I will drop this case right now if you let me slam your balls in this door,

dialogues.speaker: CLIENT
dialogues.text: JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident! ADLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not according to our investigation. We believe that, in fact, there was gross negligence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The employees, same ones in the breakroom, are milling around, talking, the idea of the strike gaining momentum. Rory points up to the confrence room. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard those guys up there are the guys from General Mills.
Employees' POV: Adler pacing around, yelling, Joel yellin back, etc. [They can't hear any of it.] MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm... JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, now they're probably up there negotiating right now -- cuttin' up the pie that we baked. That's what it looks like to me. The employees all nod in agreement. Employees POV: Adler pointing at his balls, pointing to t door again, about to slam it. One of his lawyers stops hi RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta act fast. They could be about to close the deal. JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and leave us out in the cold. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, then it's too late. If they've already sold it we can't get a piece of it. We gotta act fast. We need to do one of those walk outs. JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we better do it now. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, who's in? We need a show of force. Come on, it's now or never... We PAN around the employees as the idea builds momentum, ending on HECTOR, who looks completely confused by it all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting heats up.
ADLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then, let me go back to my previous offer: I will gladly come down on that price -- I'll come all the way down to zero and drop this case -- if you go over there right now and slam your testicles in that door! Because-- JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna slam my testicles in the door! I want you to be reasonable! You won't even budge one penny! Come on! ADLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I say, if you slam your-- JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll slam your balls in the door! ADLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, did you just threaten me? Brian puts his hand on Joel, motions him to calm down. BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we need to cool off a minute. We'll be right back. Brian leads Joel out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need this. I'm going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel walks down the stairs. The group of employees see hi and ready themselves for the big confrontation. Joel noti them all looking at him and stops. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?... What? But they are ill-prepared. No one knows who should talk first. It's incredibly awkward. They all look at each oth and mutter things like, "go ahead" "you first". Finally..
RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm... We were just uh... JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Rory was talking about how you guys are doing this deal with General Mills and we just think that ah... We were considering the idea of ah... RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we just think that we should maybe get a piece of it, you know cuz we do all the work... And if we don't... um... Joel's in no mood for this. He goes off on them. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? Fine. Fine. You're all in charge -- all of you. (gestures to all the EMPLOYEES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As of now. You run the goddamn place. Go ahead. In fact, you can go up there right now and meet with Adler. He may slam your balls in the door, but woohoo! You're the boss! Joel storms out, leaving the employees standing there. A BICKERING MATCH erupts over who was supposed to do the talking, who said they would say what, who backed down fi etc. "I was gonna say something but you interrupted," "Yo didn't say anything when he was leaving, so I thought you were quitting. I would've stood up to him." As the argument dies down, one by one they all go back to their posts, muttering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel is sitting at the table, picking at some food, looki miserable. Suzie comes over, gathers up her nerve. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Joel, there's something I have to tell you. I think we need to be honest with each other. Suzie sits down.
SUZIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure how to say this, but -- well, you've been so caught up in you're work lately, and I'm here alone all day and sometimes I just-- JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You banged the pool cleaner. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha... Suzie is stunned. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you're trying to tell me right? You had sex with Brad? SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I knew. I hired him. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I know you hired him, but how did you know about-- JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean I hired him to clean the pool, I mean I hired him to have sex with you. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a gigolo Suzie. Suzie is stupefied. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... what... Why? Joel is so fed up, he just tells her everything. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hired him to have an affair with you so that I could have an affair without feeling guilty. I was really drunk and on some kind of horse tranquilizer and--
SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad was getting paid?... (disbelief, hurt) So you've been paying Brad this whole time? All fifteen times?! JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIFTEEN TIMES?! Jesus Christ Suzie! Joel sinks into his chair, shaking his head. JOEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only paid him once -- well, twice. The rest was on the house. Long beat as Suzie tries to let it all sink in. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to have an affair with another woman? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But I didn't. Suzie paces around for a moment, reeling, processing all this. Then, decisively, SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asshole. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm the asshole? SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! How could you? JOEL (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I? How could you?!!! You didn't have to have sex with him. You could've simply said "No thanks. Just clean the pool," but you didn't, did you?! No, you took him up on his little offer and had sex with him -- fifteen times! SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of this would've happened if you hadn't hired him.
JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'll admit, I made a big mistake. I was drunk, on drugs, stressed, sexually frustrated and I shouldn't have hired a male prostitute to seduce you. But if you had simply been faithful, none of this would've happened. Suzie just looks at him for a beat. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sick, you know that? Beat. Joel can't really argue this point. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you see in Brad anyway? He's borderline retarded. You probably could've been arrested for having sex with a guy that dumb. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. I'm leaving. Suzie heads for the door. Joel follows after her. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You're not leaving me. I'm leaving you! SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Joel opens the door, about to storm out, only to find NATHAN, standing right there about to ring the doorbell. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey guys. Glad I caught ya. You guys hardly ever answer the door. Heh heh. They are both so flustered, they can barely talk. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now's not a good time Nathan. Joel turns around, storms off back into the house. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you guys goin' somewhere?
SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Look, we can't talk right now. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you think I could go ahead and get that check from ya then? I'm just trying to balance my checkbook here... SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now's not a good time. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When would be a good time, you think? SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See the thing is-- SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay tomorrow. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, what time? SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Just come by tomorrow. I can't talk now. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay great. And if you could just go ahead and have that check, that'd be great. It's a hundred and ten. That's two plates at FIFTY-FIVE-- SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Okay... Suzie shuts the door, cutting him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel checks into an Extended Stay America hotel.(a chain hotels that rent by the week.) Quick shot of Joel sitting alone in the room. He drops hi suitcase and glumly sits down on the bed, grabs the remot

He turns on Spectravision and surfs the Adult titles, dec he's not into it and switches back to regular TV only to American Idol is on. He stares at it for a beat, then flo down on the bed and stares at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel sits at the bar, drowning his sorrows. Dean is over the cash register, tending to some business. Brad enters, walks over to Joel. Joel looks the other way. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man... I know you probably want to kick my ass, but-- JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't kick your ass if I wanted to. You're a good 10 years younger than me, and I'm a pussy. So why don't you just leave me alone. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to tell you, I'm not gonna see Suzie anymore. You don't have to worry. Joel keeps drinking his beer, stares straight ahead. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last time I was over there, she broke it off; told me to quit coming over... She said she was gonna tell you everything -- you know, about us. She's really into you dude. I guess that's why she married you an' shit... You're a lucky guy... Sorry if I messed shit up. Beat. Joel takes another swig. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you have to get hung up on Suzie? You could have any girl you want. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I want Suzie. And I can't have her. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had her fifteen times.
BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but she doesn't love me dude. It's just not the same... Anyway, just wanted to tell you that. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... You told me. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, later... Brad starts to leave. Then he stops, turns around. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, one more thing... I quit my landscaping job... And I don't think I'm really cut out to be a gigolo. So I was wondering if you had any openings over there at your extract place? JOEL (EXASPERATED SIGH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad, you had sex with my wife. I'm not gonna give you a job, okay? BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Sorry man. Brad walks away. Joel stares at his beer for a beat, thinking. He calls out to Brad. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Brad?... Brad stops. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... Maybe come by the office tomorrow. Fill out an application. I'll see what I can do. BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. Thanks man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian sits with Joel. They both look pretty miserable. Brian looks down at some papers, shaking his head. BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're screwed. General Mills has pretty much withdrawn the offer pending a really favorable settlement with Step. (shaking his head) Not only do we not sell the company, we could wind up bankrupt. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering to himself) So I don't sell the company, don't get the money, I'm bankrupt, I don't get Cindy, I paid a guy to have sex with my wife, and she actually did it... BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzie is trying to clean the pool herself, struggling wit the long pole with the net at the end. She looks miserabl

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello? Nathan enters through the back gate. SUZIE (MUTTERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... Nathan walks over to Suzie. She's in no mood for this. Sh acts as unfriendly as possible. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you cleaning the pool yourself? That new guy didn't work out?
SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, didn't work out. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, you just can't get good help, eh? SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, did you get a chance to write that check? SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Nathan, Joel and I aren't going to that dinner okay? Nathan acts deeply disappointed. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well gee, I wish you would've told me that before I went and bought the tickets. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel never agreed to this Nathan, and neither did I. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it sure sounded like you guys were going. Leslie was gonna talk to you about it, but you didn't return our calls. I mean, I already bought these tickets. They're nonrefundable. I really wish you guys had been a little more clear with me... It's the last straw. Suzie has had enough. She unleashes all her pent-up aggression on Nathan. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let me be really clear with you then. When we say "I don't think so," or even "I'm not sure," that means "no." Why can't you understand that? NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just--
SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! In fact, let me be even more clear with you. We don't like you! Is that clear enough? You're dull, you never shut up, you never listen, and we don't want anything to do with you ever again! Nathan freezes, in some kind of state of shock. He starts shake a little. Suzie just keeps going -- it feels too go to stop. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that clear enough for you Nathan?! Is that...? Nathan starts to go into some kind of seizure. SUZIE (WORRIED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan? Nathan's eyes roll back into his head, and he collapses. Suzie SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel pulls into the parking lot. He looks surprised, seei something on the other side of the lot that gets his attention. JOEL (TO HIMSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way... From JOEL'S POV, we see Cindy pull up and get out of her Joel watches as she gets out with a grocery bag and heads the stairs. Joel gets out and watches her from a distance He sees her go into a room and shut the door. He stares up at the door for a beat. Then, with a look of determination, Joel walks up the stairs and knocks on her door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy opens the door, a little startled to see Joel, but pleasant to him. CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Joel. I ah,...
JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you...? What's up? How'd you know I was here? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, actually, I'm staying here too. Down on the first floor, around the back. I thought I saw you so I ah... CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, come in. Joel enters, stands in the living room. Cindy heads in to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: CINDY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Do you want something to drink? I think all I have is Diet Coke. Joel notices MARY'S PURSE lying on the coffee table. He stares at it. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. Cindy comes back in with a Diet Coke. CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a seat. Joel remains standing, looking at the purse. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Mary's purse... Isn't it? CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right there. That's Mary's purse. CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that? No, that's mine... So how are things at work? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Mary's purse. You stole it, didn't you?
Cindy acts like he's being silly. There's nothing about h demeanor that would make anybody think she's lying. CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It probably just looks like it. There's a lot of those. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen another one. You probably have Sylvia's wallet in here somewhere too, don't you? And everything else that's been stolen from my employees. CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel, are you okay? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not. That's Mary's purse Goddammit! Okay? Everyone blamed Hector. He almost got fired. Doesn't that bother you? CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocent, sweet) Joel, I don't know what you're-- JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector! Hard working guy, never did anything wrong. And what are you doing with Step? You're trying to screw him out of his settlement money aren't you? CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you're talking about. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you do! You're the only reason he's suing us aren't you? You know how much work it took for me to build up that company? You just don't care about anybody do you? What are you, some kind of sociopath? Cindy looks like Joel might be getting to her. JOEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't even admit that you stole this purse can you? You just can't do it. (MORE)
JOEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, you probably can't tell the truth about much of anything, can you?... Cindy turns away from him, looking down at the floor. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet Cindy's not even your real name is it? Who are you? Where the hell are you from? Cindy, still looking away, doesn't answer. JOEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't answer can you? Because if you said one true thing, you'd have to tell the truth about something else and then it would all unravel wouldn't it? Then you'd have to admit that you stole this purse and God knows what else. Beat. Cindy still looking away, down at the floor. We see her eyes well up, about to cry, but Joel doesn't notice. JOEL (COMPOSES HIMSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm leaving now. Joel picks up the purse. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm taking this purse with me. If it really is yours, you can call the police and tell 'em I stole it... In fact, I'm gonna call the police and report it... Joel walks towards the door. Then Cindy slumps down on th couch, mutters something, still looking down at the floor her voice cracking slightly. CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't... Joel stops. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?
CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still looking down) Please don't report it to the police. I'm on probation. I'll go to jail. For a long time. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Maybe you should've thought about that before you started ripping off my employees. Joel starts to open the door. CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel? Please? I'll leave Step alone. I promise. He'll drop the lawsuit. Joel considers this. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know that? CINDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can keep the purse. If I don't leave him alone; if he doesn't drop the lawsuit, then you can report me. Please? Beat. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm... I guess that ah... Do you have Sylvia's wallet, and Jim's watch? Can I get those too? Beat. Cindy nods, still looking down. Joel considers it. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Okay then. I guess that works. (REALIZING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I guess you just admitted that you stole the purse. That's good, I guess... A step in the right direction... Joel sits down on the couch also. With her head still dow Cindy is weeping quietly. Joel doesn't notice, looking straight ahead.
JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your deal anyway?... I mean, how did you end up like this? Joel finally looks over, notices that she's crying. He's caught off guard. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Ah... Cindy? Cindy breaks down and starts bawling. JOEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, now you see... that's what I'm talking about. You're trying to manipulate me now, and I'm not gonna fall for it... Cindy starts bawling even harder. JOEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really hope you're not faking this right now, because I'm feeling really bad. Are you faking it? Cindy shakes her head "no." JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I was just curious, you know, how a person ends up like... this... Cindy suddenly starts BAWLING hysterically. Joel stands there awkwardly, not sure if he should hug he comfort her in any way. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. I'm sorry... Joel tentatively puts a comforting arm around her and she leans in to him, crying on his chest. He puts his other arm around her and she snuggles in even closer. As her crying gradually subsides she snuggles in even more. Finally, she lifts her head and they start kissing. As they get hot and heavy we DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide shot of the Hotel. It's a beautiful morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel wakes up, looking more relaxed than we've ever seen We PULL OUT to reveal that he's alone in Cindy's bed. He sits up, yawns. He has a big satisfied smile on his face. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy? He looks around, realizes he's alone. Then suddenly looks worried. JOEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit! He scrambles for his pants, then looks relieved as he realizes his wallet is still there. He sets down the pant then after a beat, picks them up again, checks inside the wallet and sees there's still cash and credit cards. Then looks up at the chest of drawers and sees: Mary's purse, Sylvia's wallet, and a watch, placed side by side. He lies back in bed, and shuts his eyes, grinning again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extract bottles moving along the assembly line full steam Mary and Gabriella gossiping. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at her watch) Joel hasn't been in all morning. can you believe that? GABRIELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we come in late, we get fired. And here we're working our tails off, and he's gonna get rich. Joel walks in, bright-eyed and cheery, greeting people. H walks over to Mary carrying her PURSE. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go Mary.
Joel hands her the purse. Mary looks at it, not quite sur how to react, not ever wanting to appear grateful for anything -- not in her nature. JOEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by the way, Hector didn't take it. Cindy did. Joel walks off. Mary just shakes her head at him. She whispers to Gabriella. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you believe that? Blaming Cindy just to protect Hector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel is at his desk. Brian comes in. BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step's here to see you. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Bring him in. BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's outside. At the loading dock. Wants to talk to you alone back there for some reason. (CRUDE IMMITATION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Man to man."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step is pacing around, waiting. Joel comes out. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Step... STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin'? How's your, ah... STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down at his CROTCH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it's okay. Some days it still hurts, but they've got me on some pills. It's not too bad I guess...
JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... that's good. They both sit down on the edge of the dock. STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, ah... Cindy left me. Joel's nods, not surprised, but sympathetic. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow... Bummer... STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is a bummer... You know, I thought the worst part was having my balls knocked off, but you know what the worse part is? Dealin' with all this bullshit... I'm sick of that Adler guy tellin' me what to do. He's a real dick. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he sure is. STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is, I just want to have my old life back -- I just want to go back to work. I'm a workin' man; that's what I do. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I'm beginning to think I might be the same way... I'm a little worried about what I'd do with too much time on my hands. STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just lay around and watch TV all day. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah,... I think I do a lot worse. STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem is, if I bankrupt the company, there won't be a job to go back to. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to bankrupt the company.
STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but then if I drop the lawsuit, you'll sell the company, and the new company might not hire me. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I don't have to sell the company... You know I've been thinking; all these years I've been building this company, dreaming about the day I could sell it and retire, but what would I really do if I retired? It's like that old saying -- it's not about the destination, it's about the journey? Step just stares at him blankly, he lost him. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess what I'm saying is, too much free time might not be such a good thing -- like that old saying, idle hands are the Devil's playground? Step's never heard that one either. STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I don't do much book readin'. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm saying is, I'm thinking maybe I won't sell the company... STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: that is, if you dropped the lawsuit. -- and remember, you'll still get that insurance money -- probably a couple hundred thousand. What do you think? STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm. That sounds fair... But under one condition... JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?
STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make me floor manager. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel walks in with Step at his side. Addresses the employees. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold the line! Mary shuts off the conveyer belt. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, listen up everybody. (Waits for them to settle) I've decided not to sell the company... Gasps and murmurs among the employees. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm making Step the new Floor Manager. More gasps and murmurs. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if anyone doesn't like it, I hear they're hiring over at Gemco... But just remember, at Gemco, the owner doesn't know your names; you never even meet him, he's at an office up in Chicago somewhere and you get an auto- response if you try to email him to complain about anything. Here, you can come up to my office any time you have a problem. Thanks. Joel walks off. Brian catches up with him. BRIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? You're not selling?
JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about the journey Brian. The journey. ANGLE on Mary. She and Gabrielle start right back up. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, if Joel's going to put him in charge, we should go on strike. You know, at Gemco, the union handles the strikes and you don't even have to-- PULL OUT as Step cuts her off. STEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit yapping and get back to work or you're fired. Step walks off -- maybe pops a testosterone pill. Mary an Gabrielle keep muttering and shaking their heads. LONG PULL OUT as things get back to normal at the factory

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are CLOSE ON NATHAN, in a coffin, embalmed. We PULL OU to see mourners lined up, taking a last look at the body. Joel is among them. He looks down at Nathan for a moment then continues to his seat. A few rows back, we see SUZIE sitting by herself, dressed in black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick shot of Nathan's casket being lowered into the grou as the priest says the last few words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People hug and console each other. Joel sees Suzie, walks over to her. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... You doing okay? SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm okay.
JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you were right there when it happened. That must've been rough. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was horrible Joel. He came over to ask for that check, and I just... Suzie breaks down, starts CRYING. SUZIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .I just lost it. I started yelling at him. I said horrible things. He had an aneurism and I probably caused it. (CRYING UNCONTROLLABLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the last thing I said to him was "shut up." Those were the last words he heard. Joel hugs her, consoling. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, it's not your fault... It's not your fault. Suzie's crying subsides a little. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could happen to any of us Joel. Any of us could have an aneurism. We could die at any moment. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know... I know... But we probably won't. It'll be alright. Suzie starts to regain her composure. They stand there for a beat. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna go get something to eat... or something? Beat. Suzie still sniffling a little. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. Sure.
They walk off towards the cemetery gates. After a while, Joel hands Suzie a Kleenex. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here... SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. They walk a little further. Joel looks at the Chapel near JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should've been married in a Church like that one. Instead of the Botanical Gardens. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you liked the Botanical Gardens? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but... a church just seems more -- I don't know -- official. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it would've made a difference? JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... So, are we still married? SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, legally yes. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean otherwise. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm... We can talk about it I suppose. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. They walk for a beat. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this is really bad, but... Oh never mind. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?
JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, as I was looking down at Nathan there, I was thinking... That's the longest I've ever seen him with his mouth shut. Suzie LAUGHS in spite of herself. SUZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel! They walk off into the distance as we FADE OUT. THE END
